meanings.definition: Completely broken or not functioning properly.
meanings.sent1: The old car went kerflooey and wouldn't start.
meanings.sent2: The computer screen went kerflooey and displayed only a blank screen.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party decorations went kerflooey when the wind blew them away.
meanings.sent4: Her plans for a peaceful evening went kerflooey when her noisy neighbors started a party.
meanings.sent5: The leaky faucet went kerflooey and flooded the kitchen with water.

meanings.definition: In a state of chaos or disorder.
meanings.sent1: The messy room looked kerflooey with clothes scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The traffic became kerflooey after the accident on the highway.
meanings.sent3: Her hair looked kerflooey after being caught in a strong gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was kerflooey with papers flying around during the prank.
meanings.sent5: The garden appeared kerflooey with weeds taking over the flower beds.

meanings.definition: To fail or go wrong suddenly.
meanings.sent1: His plan to surprise her went kerflooey when she found out beforehand.
meanings.sent2: The presentation went kerflooey when the projector stopped working midway.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick went kerflooey when the rabbit refused to come out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: The camping trip went kerflooey when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent5: The experiment went kerflooey due to a miscalculation in the measurements.
